title: Quiz 10: Comprehensive Unit Review
description: The final challenge! A comprehensive review covering Concepts, Principles, Statistics, Organisation, and IEC.

questions.question: Which principle states that health care should place maximum reliance on available community resources?
questions.explanation: Hentsch (1985) emphasized reliance on available community resources.
questions.hint: A specific author mentioned in Section 2.

questions.question: Growth Rate = Crude Birth Rate (%) - ___BLANK___ (%).
questions.explanation: Growth rate is the difference between birth rate and death rate.

questions.question: Which of the following packages are **High Priority** in the National Health Sector Strategic Plan? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Malaria, IMCI, and HIV/AIDS are High Priority. Eye infections are Low; Cancers are Medium.

questions.question: Arrange the hierarchy of a health talk preparation:
Match the agent to its classification:
questions.explanation: Classifying agents of disease based on their nature and origin.

questions.question: What type of family consists of members of nuclear families and other relatives like aunts and grandparents?
questions.explanation: An Extended Family includes the nuclear family plus other relatives.
questions.hint: It extends beyond parents and children.

questions.question: The District Medical Officer of Health (DMOH) is the chairman of the District Health Management Team.
Which statistic uses a numerator that is NOT part of the denominator?
questions.explanation: A Ratio compares two different things (e.g., 3:1), where the numerator is not part of the denominator.

questions.question: What is the main goal of **Secondary Prevention**?
questions.explanation: Secondary prevention aims at early diagnosis and treatment (cure) before complications arise.

questions.question: Which of the following are External Factors affecting family health? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Climate, Water, and Housing are external environment factors. Size is internal.
